PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: U--Education and Training Services OFFADD: Department of Defense Education Activity, Hqs, Procurement Div, 4040 N. Fairfax Drive, 4th Floor, Arlington, VA 22203 SUBJECT: U--TRAINING WORKSHOP ON CHEMICAL HYGIENE AND SAFETY FOR TEACHERS AND LIAISONSM SOL MDA410-00-R-0004 DUE 050800 POC Ms. Melissa Phillips, 703-696-3844 x1414 DESC: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for two training workshops for liaisons and teachers that will cover chemical safety policy, procedures, and responsibilities. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation for this requirement. Written proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. The solicitation number is MDA410-00-R-0004. The solicitation is being issued as a Request for Proposal (RFP). Duration of the initial contract shall not exceed one year following date of award, with four one-year option periods which shall be exercised at the sole discretion of the contracting officer. If an option year is required, the contracting officer will advise the contractor in writing at least 30 days prior to expiration of the contract. General background information regarding DoDEA is available on the internet at http://www.odedodea.edu . A. Background: The Department of Defense Education Activity (DoDEA) has the responsibility to follow regulations established by the Office of Safety and Health Agency (OSHA) in overseas locations. In compliance with OSHA regulations concerning hazardous chemicals, DoDEA implemented DS Regulation 4800.4. This regulation, available at http://www.odedodea.edu/foia/iod/PDF/4800_4.PDF, establishes chemical safety policy, procedures, and responsibilities for all levels of administration within DoDEA. B. Purpose and Intent: The Department of Defense Education Activity (DoDEA) requires a contractor to conduct two training workshops for liaisons and teachers that will cover the regulatory compliance and risk management of the DoDEA Chemical Hygiene Regulation, DS Regulation 4800.4. The training will also include, when appropriate, the interface of the DoDEA Regulation with the regulations published by OSHA. Each training workshop will be 40 hours in length for up to 30 participants per workshop. Dates of the base year training workshops are June 19-23, 2000 in Fort Bragg, North Carolina and August 7-11, 2000 in Wiesbaden, Germany. The training for the option years is anticipated to be at the same two locations in the summers of 2001, 2002, 2003, and 2004. C. Requirements/ Tasks to be Performed: C.1. One workshop that consists of 40 hours distributed over 5 days, June 19-23, 2000 in Ft. Bragg, North Carolina. A second workshop that consists of 40 hours distributed over 5 days, August 7-11, 2000 in Wiesbaden, Germany. C.2. The workshop topics shall include: a) fundamentals of lab safety, b) legal aspects of hazardous chemicals and safety, c) clean up techniques for hazardous materials, d) leadership responsibilities for the Chemical Hygiene Officer (CHO), e) educational responsibilities for the Chemical Hygiene Officer (CHO), f) inspection procedures and identification of weaknesses/strengths in lab procedures, g) compliance with OSHA regulations, h) risk management, i) techniques for managing the CHO responsibilities, j) operating within the Excel environment, k) using the DoDEA chemical database in Excel, l) components of a Chemical Hygiene Plan, and m) development of a Chemical Hygiene Plan. C.3. The workshop shall be highly participatory, using interactive discussions, small groups, demonstrations, mini-case analysis with appropriate visual and media support, and hands-on experiences and training with computers and the Excel spreadsheet and chemical database. C.4. All training materials are to be provided by the contractor. These materials are to be current and up-to-date and sufficiently complete to be used as a resource guide by the participants following the workshop. The inclusion of available audio and/or visual supplemented materials is considered a high priority. C.5. The contractor shall be responsible for shipping all materials to the workshop site and providing information about the seating arrangement for the training room. C.6. Workshop materials are to be integrated with the DoDEA chemical database that is compatible with MS DOS and Microsoft Office Excel software. C.7. The contractor shall provide follow up feedback (i.e., specific questions concerning disposal of hazardous chemicals, storage requirements, etc.) to participants for 60 days immediately following the workshop via phone, e-mail, or FAX. C.9. Contractor shall prepare a final report that includes follow up activities with participants and evaluation of the workshops. D. Technical Requirements: D.1. Contractor must be fully aware of the DoDEA CHO Regulation 4800.4, and all OSHA regulations that apply to the middle and high school environments. D.2. Contractor must have knowledge and experience with requirements for handling and disposing of hazardous chemicals in foreign countries where DoDEA schools are located. D.3. Contractor should have extensive experience in delivering an interactive CHO workshop to educational specialists and non-science majors that covers the DoDEA CHO Regulation 4800.4 and the OSHA regulations. D.4. Contractor will have materials that can be delivered in two (2) 40-hour workshops and will extensively cover the problems of chemical disposal, chemical storage and handling, chemical clean up, safety inspections, and educational laboratory practices for K-12 education. Prepared surveys, forms, and other educational materials will be included in the package. D.5. Contractor will have experience in using electronic databases for monitoring chemical supplies, and will be able to integrate this knowledge into the workshop. E. Deliverables and Reporting Requirements for the base year: E.1. Provide the Science Coordinator with one copy of course materials that will be used in the training session by June 1, 2000. E.2. Conduct one 40-hour workshop in Ft. Bragg, North Carolina on June 19-23, 2000 E.3. Conduct one 40-hour workshop in Wiesbaden, Germany from August 7-11, 2000. E.4. Provide resource package for each participant (up to 25 copies) by June 19, 2000 and August 7, 2000. E.5. Provide follow up support to participants via phone/FAX from June 26-Oct. 13, 2000. E.6. Provide final report to Science Coordinator by November 3, 2000. F. DESCRIPTIVE LITERATURE FOR EVALUATION PURPOSES- Submission of descriptive literature shall consist of a technical proposal addressing: (1) a brief synopsis of no more than two pages addressing the requirements detailed in Section C, Requirements/Tasks to be Performed, (2) a paragraph listing the qualifications of the trainers and (3) a list of the training sessions performed in the last year and (4) the five references as mentioned in Section C. In addition, the Offeror shall submit a cost proposal for the two training workshops including preparation and materials, training, and follow-up. The base and four option periods should be separately priced. Contractor travel required to conduct classes at government facilities shall be compensated IAW the Joint Travel Regulations, FAR 31.205-45, and should not be included in the cost proposal. G-EVALUATION- The offerors shall explain in their proposals whether or not their solution meets each of the requirements detailed in this synopsis/solicitation, addressing each item in "C. REQUIREMENTS/TASKS TO BE PERFORMED" individually. The government will award a contract to the offeror that provides the greatest overall benefit in response to this synopsis/solicitation including price and other factors - this is a best value procurement. The rating of the proposal in the technical evaluation will be the most important factor in the evaluation. Cost to the government will be the second most important factor. Past performance will also be evaluated, as the third most important factor. The selected offeror must demonstrate an acceptable past performance record by submitting the names, addresses and telephone numbers of at least five (5) recent customers who will provide information concerning the quality of the product(s) and support provided by the offeror. The contractor must have experience providing training workshops to Middle and High School teachers. The government reserves the right to award a contract based on initial proposals, on a "best value" basis as described above. If the government instead determines that further evaluation is required, the government will make a competitive-range determination and notify all offerors whether their proposal is in the competitive-range or not. It is anticipated that a firm-fixed price contract with a base plus four one-year options will result from this RFP. The SIC for this acquisition is 8748. This acquisition has NOT been designated as a Small or Small and Disadvantaged Business set-aside, but note that FAR clauses 52.219-8 and 52.222-26 are included by reference. All offerors must be preregistered with DoD, if they are not already registered with the Central Contractor Registry they may do so at http://www.ccr2000.com. Offerors are to include a completed copy of the provisions at 52.212-3-Offeror Representations and Certifications-Commercial Items with their bid. The following clauses also apply: 52.212-1 Instructions to Offeror-Commercial Items, 52.212-2 Evaluation-Commercial Items, 52.212-4 Contract Terms and Conditions-Commercial Items, 52.212-5 Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items including clauses checked 52.203-6, Restrictions on Subcontractor Sales to the Government, with Alternate I (41 U.S.C. 253g and 10 U.S.C. 2402), 52.222-21, Prohibition of Segregated Facilities (Feb 1999), 52.222-26, Equal Opportunity (E.O. 11246), 52.222-35, Affirmative Action for Disabled Veterans and Veterans of the Vietnam Era (38 U.S.C. 4212), 52.222-36, Affirmative Action for Workers with Disabilities (29 U.S.C. 793), 52.232-33, Payment by Electronic Funds Transfer--Central Contractor Registration (31 U.S.C. 3332), 52.217-9 Option to Extend the Term of the Contract (Nov 1999). This solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 97-11. The clauses are incorporated by reference, with the same force and effect as if they were given in full text. Clauses can be viewed in full text at the following Internet Addresses: http://www.ARNET.gov and http://www.GSA.gov/FAR. Quotes are being solicited on an unrestricted basis. The due date for submission of proposals is 08 May 2000 at 4:00 PM EST to DoD Education Activity, 4th floor Procurement Division, Attn: Melissa Phillips, 4040 N. Fairfax Dr., Arlington, VA 22203-1635. Award is anticipated by 17 May 2000. All requests for information regarding this solicitation are to be directed to Melissa Phillips, Contract Specialist - (703) 696-3846 ext. 1414. Technical and/or administrative questions must be received no later than five (5) business days after publication of this notice and may be tele-faxed to (703) 696-4871, or mailed to the address for submission of proposals shown above. Or, you can e-mail your questions to mphillip@hq.odedodea.edu. In order to prepare the offeror's mailing list as well as distribution of possible amendments to the solicitation, please fax your company's name, address, telephone and fax numbers, and point of contact as soon as possible. Failure to do so will preclude DoDEA from the responsibility of providing you with possible amendments or other required information. It is the vendor's responsibility to make sure that the named DoDEA representative has received all faxed and/or E-mail information. Offerors are responsible to comply with this notice and any amendments thereto. LINKURL: http://www.odedodea.edu/foia/iod/PDF/4800_4.PDF LINKDESC: concerning hazardous chemicals. EMAILADD: mphillip@hq.odedodea.edu EMAILDESC: CITE: (W-115 SN448018)
[Commerce Business Daily: Posted in CBDNet on April 21, 2000] [Printed Issue Date: April 26, 2000]

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: V--Transportation, Travel, and Relocation Services OFFADD: Department of Commerce, NOAA, 200 World Trade Center, Room 209, Norfolk, VA 23510-1624 SUBJECT: V--CHARTER OF COASTAL RESEARCH VESSELS SOL EASC 00-85 POC Edith W. McIntyre, Contract Specialist, (757) 441-6648 DESC: The Department of Commerce, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), Northeast Fisheries Science Center (NEFSC), Woods Hole, Massachusetts has a requirement for the charter of two Illex squid fishing vessels. The two vessels shall be involved in conducting a bottom trawl survey of Illex illecebrosus (Illex squid) in U.S. waters (60-200 F) between Georges Bank and Cape Hatteras, North Carolina. The charter period shall not exceed eleven sea days. A sea day is defined as any part of a calendar day spent steaming to or from a vessel's home port and Wood's Hole, for the purpose of conducting the survey, and the days actually spent conducting the survey. Conducting the survey is defined as steaming to each station, towing at each station location and laying to due to bad weather or equipment failure. The vessel shall arrive at the NEFSC dock in Woods Hole, MA, no later than 7:00 A.M. on May 20, 2000, prepared with the necessary fuel, food and crew to conduct an eleven-day cruise. Loading of the scientific staff and their equipment will begin at 7:00 A.M. on May 20, 2000 for a shake-down cruise. Immediately following the loading of the scientific party and equipment, the cruise will depart and will be completed no later than May 30, 2000. Each vessel shall return scientists and equipment to the NEFSC dock upon completion of the cruise. All responsible sources may submit a quotation which will be considered. No telephone requests will be accepted. Only written or faxed requests are acceptable. Fax number is (757) 441-3786. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: X--Lease or Rental of Facilities OFFADD: U S Postal Service, Facilities Service Office, 8055 E Tufts Avenue, Suite 400, Denver, CO 80237-2881 SUBJECT: X--NEW CONSTRUCTION LEASED - ECKERT CO 81418-9998 - MAIN OFFICE SOL 072976-00-A-0102 DUE 053000 POC Greg Eymann, Real Estate Specialist (303) 220-6571 or Tom Stephen, Design&Construction Project Manager (303) 220-6534 DESC: The United States Postal Service is completing final site and building design plans for a new leased building of 3,350 gross SF on a controlled site containing 43,560 gross SF, with an Assignable Option to Purchase price of $50,000.00 in Eckert CO, for lease back to the Postal Service for a basic lease term of twenty (20) years plus two (2) five-year renewal options. Any award made under this solicitation will be made to the responsible offeror who provides the best overall value to the Postal Service. This is NOT a sealed bid advertisement, and proposals will NOT be publicly opened. Solicitation packages will be available on or about April 24, 2000. Please identify your request with the solicitation number. Submit request with a NON-REFUNDABLE check or money order for $100.00 per set made payable to A&D Draft Aid, PO Box 40877, Denver CO 80204-0877. Visa and Mastercard also accepted. Information concerning solicitation packages should be directed to Diana Esquerra, A&D Draft Aid at (303) 573-5757, Fax (303) 573-8714. For specific project details, call or write Greg Eymann, Real Estate Specialist, U S Postal Service, 8055 East Tufts Avenue, Suite 400, Denver CO 80237-2881; telephone (303) 220-6571. Offerors are encouraged to submit their proposals to the Real Estate Specialist by one of the methods offered by the U S Postal Service (First Class, Priority Mail, or Express Mail). Submissions will not be returned. CITE: (W-115 SN447868)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: X--Lease or Rental of Facilities OFFADD: General Services Administration, Public Buildings Service (PBS), Realty Services (7P), 819 Taylor Street, Fort Worth, TX, 76102 SUBJECT: X--U.S. GOVERNMENT SEEKS LEASE SPACE IN CORPUS CHISTI, TX SOL 0TX0194 DUE 050300 POC Daphne Hadley, Realty Specialist, Phone (817) 978-3358, Fax (817) 978-7098, Email daphne.hadley@gsa.gov - Daphne Hadley, Realty Specialist, Phone (817) 978-3358, Fax (817) 978-7098, Email daphne.hadley@gsa.gov DESC: REQUIREMENTS: General Services Administration is interested in leasing approximately 24,205 rentable square feet of space which will produce approximately 20,495 BOMA usable square feet and 26 parking spaces. There are four agencies involved in this procurement. The leasing action may be for more than one location and/or in multiple blocks of space. GSA will require 10,978 rentable square feet contiguous space on the first floor which will produce 9,546 BOMA usable square feet for the Internal Revenue Service with 9 inside parking spaces; 8,851 rentable square feet which will produce 7,696 BOMA usable square feet for the United States Coast Guard with 10 parking space for Government vehicles; 3,212 rentable square feet which will product 2,240 BOMA usable square feet for the United State Customs Service with 4 parking places; and 1,162 rentable square feet which will produce 1,010 BOMA usable square feet for United State Department of Agriculture with 3 parking spaces. LEASE TERM: 10 years, 5 years firm. UNIQUE REQUIREMENTS: IRS will require first floor contiguous space. The Government would like to award the lease (or leases) within 30 days of the market survey. Offerors need to demonstrate ability to execute the lease by June 12, 2000. LOCATION: Offered properties must be located within a radius of 2 miles of the Central Business District. EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST SHOULD INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: 1) Building name and address 2) Square footage offered 3) Method of Measurement used to determine rentable square feet. 4) Name, address, and telephone number of individual to be contacted 5) Evidence of authority to represent the owner. AUTHORIZED CONTACTS: In no event shall the Offerors enter into negotiations concerning the space to be leased with representatives of Federal Agencies other than the officers and employees of General Services Administration. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: X--Lease or Rental of Facilities OFFADD: USDA, APHIS, Field Servicing Office, Butler Square West, 5th Floor, 100 North 6th St., Minneapolis, MN 55403 SUBJECT: X--TEMPORARY LODGING SOL 53-M-APHIS-00 DUE 042700 POC Jeanne Lewis (612)370-2109 DESC: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional formation included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation/proposals that are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. This solicitation documents and incorporates provisions and clauses that are in effect through Federal Circular 97-16. This acquisition is a 100% Small Business Set Aside. The SIC is 7011. The United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), Animal Plant Health Inspection Service (APHIS), Professional Development Center (PDC) requires the rental of fully furnished studio units for Government employees attending training in Frederick, Maryland, for the period of approximately 9 weeks. SPECIFICATIONS: FULLY EQUIPPED KITCHEN, Temporary lodging for Government employees attending training in Frederick, Maryland for a period of approximately 9 weeks. LOCATION: The lodging facility shall be located within a 12 mile radius of the Professional Development Center, located at 69 Thomas Johnson Drive, Frederick, Maryland 21702. ACCOMMODATIONS: The facility must include the following: A. Single sleeping rooms with the following minimum equipment and services provided in each room: three feet of space for hanging clothes; one four drawer chest of drawers; one desk and chair ; soap, drinking cups, and blankets B. Each unit shall include a small refrigerator, microwave and electric coffee maker C. Cleaning Services: Daily room services to be performed. Clean towels, washcloths, trash removal, cleaning bathroom, making bed and vacuuming will be included in the daily room service. C. Phone services to be billed to the employees weekly with no charge for unconnected local or long distance calls. 3. CANCELLATIONS: Individual rooms can be canceled after giving 24 hours notice. 4. Quality of service: The USDA will survey the employees to assess contract compliance and quality of service. If at any time more than 25 percent of the employees express reasonable displeasure with the lodging, the Government will terminate the contract after giving 72 hours notice. Rental shall be as requested and anything less than a month shall be prorated on a daily basis. The Government housing shall include one efficiency studio with fully equipped kitchen. Maid service is required on a weekly basis. Each one bedroom efficiency studio unit shall be completely furnished with a minimum of the following: Three feet of space for hanging clothes; One four drawer chest of drawers Dining room table and 2 chairs; One sofa or recliner, table with table lamp and chair to accommodate business/study needs, cable Television Fully equipped kitchen with refrigerator, stove top, microwave, coffee maker and cooling utensils; Blinds and/or drapes shall be on every window The studio unit shall also include a minimum of the following items: 2 piece place setting of dishes, flatware, beverage glasses, place-mats napkins, hotpads, serving spoons and steak knives, carving and paring knives; Silverware tray, cookware set, spatula, mixing/serving bowls, rubber scraper, casserole dish, 2 quart oblong baking dish, wire whisk, grater, potato peeler, colander, spatula, tong, graduated measuring spoon set, juice pitcher with lid, butter dish with lid, paper towels and holder, and dish drainer set; salt and pepper set, bottle opener/juice can opener, electric coffee maker, tea kettle, dish clothes, dish towels, toaster, and dust pan and brush; waste baskets: 3 (1 each for the bathroom, kitchen and bedroom area); clock radio and desk telephone iron and ironing board A minimum of the following linens shall be provided in each unit: 4 bath towels, wash cloths, hand towels, and 2 bath mats; 2 standard pillows with protectors along with pillow cases ; 2 blankets, 2 sets of sheets, and 1 bedspread 15 clothes hangers The studio unit shall be completely cleaned once a week and include a minimum of the following: Making bed: Clean sheets, towels and washcloths and bath mats; Trash pick up Dusting of furniture, vacuum carpets, floors swept and mopped Clean bathroom to include shower, bathtub, sink, toilet, mirrors and floor Clean kitchen to include sinks, countertops, floor, exterior surfaces of refrigerator, stove and microwave; Replenish soap, toilet paper and facial tissue A start up package to include coffee, tea, sugar and creamer packets, shampoo, soap, facial tissue and paper towels. Phone service shall be provided that can be billed to the Government employee on a bi-weekly basis. Voice mail or an answering machine shall be provided. Utilities shall be provided by the contractor to include water, sewage, electric, and trash removal. A security pass key system and a well lit area. On site Laundromat. An individual room can be canceled with a 24 hour notice without charge to the USDA. Efficiency studios shall meet all applicable city, state and federal codes and regulations. The contractor shall go through a inventory check with the USDA employee that will be occupying the room to verify all items are provided. The contractor shall go through an exit check when the USDA employee is vacating the studio unit. The USDA employee will be personally responsible for any item(s) not accounted for. The personal safety of the USDA employee is our top priority, therefore, we will not award a contract to a facility that is in an area with a high crime rate where our employees could be in danger. The facility will be inspected and the local law enforcement agency will be contacted as to the safety of our employees living in the area. Invoices and a current monthly listing shall be sent to the Contracting Officer's Representative (COR) and shall include: Name of USDA employee; Date of occupancy; Room number; Contract number. The COR for this contract is Edna Walter, 69 Thomas Johnson Drive, Frederick, MD. She may be contacted at (301)663-8598. The contract administrator is Margie Thorson and she may be contacted at (612)370-2121. SCHEDULE OF ITEMS AND PRICES: ITEM 1: Fully Equipped Kitchen; Single Occupancy, 24 participants for 64 days; May 23, 2000 - July 25, 2000; Daily Rate $ ____. OPTION YEAR; ITEM 2: Fully Equipped Kitchen; Single Occupancy, 32, participants for 64 days May 23, 2001 - July 25, 2001; Daily Rate $ ____.The Government reserves the right to verify past performance. The following FAR clauses apply to this acquisition; 52.212-1; Instructions to Offerors-Commercial Items, FAR 52.212-2; Evaluation Commercial Items; 52-212-3, Offerors Representations and Certifications--Commercial Items; FAR 52-212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions--Commercial Items and Contract Terms and Conditions--Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders--Commercial Items; FAR 52.248-1, Value Engineering; FAR 52.217-5, Evaluation of Options; FAR 52.217-9, Option to Extend the Terms of the Contract; FAR 52.217-8, Option to Extend Services; and FAR 52.222-37, Employment Reports on Disabled Veterans and Veterans of the Vietnam Era, Public Law 105-339; Past Performance will be evaluated. The Government reserves the right to award a contract without discussions. Award will be based on best value to the Government. Inspection and Acceptance required prior to award. An on-site inspection of each facility could be conducted by an agency designee prior to a contract award. The inspection will be to ensure the facility meet SOW requirements;. Offerors shall prepare proposal in accordance with Instructions to Offerors. The Government will award a contract to the responsible offeror whose offer conforms to the solicitation, technical and cost factors considered. Technical is more important than cost. Facsimile proposals are acceptable. The facsimile number (612)370-2106. The bid opening date is April 27, 2000 at 2:00 P.M., CST. Reference http://www.arnet.gov/far/fac.html for applicable forms and information. EMAILADD: jeannie.v.lewis@usda.gov EMAILDESC: CITE: (W-112 SN447694)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: Y--Construction of Structures and Facilities OFFADD: USDA-Forest Service, Pacific Northwest Region, Okanogan National Forest, 1240 S. Second Ave., Okanogan, WA 98840 SUBJECT: Y--CONSTRUCTION AND RECONSTRUCTION OF NOISY CAMPGROUND
SOL RFP-R6-8-00-15 POC Rita M. Robson Procurement Assistant 509-826-3392 DESC: NOISY CREEK CAMPGROUND - The Colville National Forest is seeking proposals for reconstruction and construction activities for Noisy Creek and Cresent Lake Campground. This project is a HUB-zone set aside and proposals will be considered only from Small Business Administration (SBA) certified HUB-zone contractors. For more information contact the SBA at www.sba.gov/hubzone Base Items, Noisy Creek CG: 1) Road reconstruction to improve site drainage and access to and through the campgrounds. 2) Construction of new, and reconstruction of existing parking areas adjacent to the boat launch. 3) Installation of four Government furnished precast concrete toilet buildings of barrier-free design. 4) Construction of new camping area (20 sites, including one host site) with new picnic tables and fire rings at each site. 5) Removal of existing picnic tables and campfire rings associated with existing campsites that are to be obliterated. 6) Obliteration of a portion of the existing camping loop roads and spurs. 7) Reconstruction or construction of trails to facilities to be barrier-free. 8) Installation of a new water distribution system throughout the new campground area, including well drilling. 9) Paving with hot mix asphalt. 10) Road signs and road closure gates. 11) Installation of bulletin boards. 12) Installation of electrical service to the host site and fee collection site. 13) Installation of prefabricated steel road bridge. 14) Installation of a treated timber trail bridge. Option items, Crescent Lake CG: 1) Installation of one Government furnished precast concrete toilet building of barrier-free design. 2) Installation of new picnic tables and fire rings at three campsites. 3) Installation of one bulletin board. Project Location: The elevation of the project areas range from about 2,000 to 2,100 feet. Noisy Creek Campground: From Spokane, WA, travel east on US Highway 2, to the junction with SR211. At this junction, turn north on SR 211 and travel to Usk, WA. At Usk, travel north on SR 20 along the Pend Oreille River to Tiger. At Tiger, continue traveling north on SR 31 along the Pend Oreille River. Travel approximately four miles north to County Road 9345 (just south of Ione, WA). Turn east on this road and cross the Pend Oreille River via the orange steel bridge. At the east end of the bridge (crossing the Pend Oreille River), continue northeast on County Road 9345 towards Sullivan Lake. Noisy Creek Campground is located at the south end of Sullivan Lake. Crescent Lake Campground: Same as above, but once on SR 31, travel through Ione to Metaline Falls. Travel through Metaline Falls towards the USA/Canada border. The project is located adjacent to SR 31 about one mile south of the USA/Canada border. For additional site information contact Lou Janke at 509-684-7230. The estimated cost of construction for campground work is $100,000- $500,000. The contract time is July 5, 2000 through November 5, 2000. A formal site visit will be conducted on May 25, 2000 at 1 pm at the Noisy Creek Campground project site. Performance or Payment Bonds are required, 100% Performance Bond and 50% Payment Bond of awarded penal sum. For solicitation copies contact Rita Robson 509-826-3392 fax requests to 509-826-3064. All responsible sources may submit an offer which will be considered. See Numbered Note 27. EMAILADD: rrobson@fs.fed.us EMAILDESC: CITE: (W-113 SN447750)

To download from EPS choose 1) EPS for Vendors 2) USAF 3) Air Combat Command and 4) Moody. It will be the contractors_ responsibility to also obtain any amendments from one of these sources. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: Y--Construction of Structures and Facilities OFFADD: U.S. Army Corps Of Engineers, Fort Worth District, P.O. Box 17300, 819 Taylor Street, Attn: CESWF-CT, Fort Worth, TX 76102-0300 SUBJECT: Y--CHILD DEVELOPMENT CENTER, DYESS AIR FORCE BASE, ABILENE, TEXAS SOL DACA63-00-B-0015 DUE 062900 POC Ruby Oringderff, Contract Specialist, (817) 978-3476 DESC: This project involves the construction of approximately 2,400 square meters of space. The one story facility will support care modules, training room, kitchen, storage areas, and administration office space. The project will include landscaping, playground space and playground equipment. The project includes demolition at various sites. Bids from large business firms must comply with FAR clause 52.219-9 regarding the requirement for submission of a subcontracting plan. Subcontracting Plan and Pre-Award information will be submitted as part of the bid. Failure to submit a Subcontracting Plan and Pre-Award Information by the closing date may result in rejection of bid. The Fort Worth District subcontracting goals are for specified percentages of the contractor's total planned subcontract amount to be placed with the following: 61.2% with small business; 9.1% with small disadvantaged business, 5.0% with women-owned small business, 2.0% with Historically Black Colleges and Universities and Minority Institutions (HBCU/Mis), and .5% with HUBZone. The estimated Cost Range is between $1,000,000 and $5,000,000. Solicitation to be issued on or about 30 May 2000. Bids are due on or about 29 June 2000. The bidding schedule will consist of three (3) different schedules, with the difference being in contract duration. The duration times will be 390 days, 420 days, and 450 days. SIC Code is 1542 and the Small Business Size Standard is $17 Million. This project will be issued UNRESTRICTED. The Government intends to issue this solicitation through the use of the Internet and CD ROM. Amendments to this solicitation will be issued as Internet only. No additional media (Floppy Disks, Faxes, or paper) will be provided unless the Government determines that it is necessary. Contractors may view/download this solicitation and all amendments from the Internet after solicitation issuance at the following Internet address: http://ebs.swf.usace.army.mil. All offerors are required to check the Ft. Worth District Contracting Division website daily to be notified of any changes to this solicitation. NO EXPRESS MAIL PROCEDURES WILL BE UTILIZED ON INITIAL MAILINGS OF PLANS AND SPECIFICTIONS. All responsible sources may submit a proposal, which will be considered by the agency. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: Y--Construction of Structures and Facilities OFFADD: USDA, Custer National Forest, 1310 Main, Billings, MT 59105 SUBJECT: Y--DRY WOLF STEWARDSHIP PROJECT - LEWIS&CLARK NATIONAL FOREST SOL RFP R1-08-00-17 DUE 071800 POC Ann Vogt (406) 657-6222, EXT. 227 OR Shirley Jackson, (406) 657-6200, EXT. 216 DESC: DRY WOLF PROJECT - This procurement is a Stewardship Contract as authorized in Section 347 of the 1999 Appropriations Bill. The project is a combination of construction and service type work which will offset the timber value of the timber offered. There will be an estimated 800 MBF of commercial timber and an estimated 100 MBF of roundwood offered in addition to the following type of work: Stream improvements to include replacement of gabions with rock type structures; hazardous tree removal; seedling/sapling planting; rehab of camping sites; furnishing and installing Sweet Smelling Toilets; Furnishing and installing picinic tables; surfacing with compacted aggregate and construction of a trail and a temporary road. Work will be required to be completed no later than October 1 of 2003. This procurement will not be a set-aside. EMAILADD: avogt/r1_custer@fed.gov EMAILDESC: CITE: (W-115 SN447928)
[Commerce Business Daily: Posted in CBDNet on April 24, 2000] [Printed Issue Date: April 26, 2000]
PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: Y--Construction of Structures and Facilities OFFADD: USDA Forest Service, Tonto National Forest, 2324 East McDowell Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85006 SUBJECT: Y--SCHOLZ DAM REHABILITATION SOL RFP R3-WZ-00-28 DUE 060800 POC Lyn McMahill, 602/225-5349 or Yolanda Mitchell, 520/527-3540 DESC: Work consists of draining the reservoir by pumping, installation of an outlet pipe and control valve, adding fill material to both dam faces to flatten slopes, and installing a sand filter drain on the downstream face. The project is located approximately 12 miles southeast of Williams, Arizona on the Kaibab National Forest. Solicitation will be available on or about 5/8/00. Contract time is 90 calendar days. Price range is between $100,000 and $250,000. Bid Guarantee is required. Fax number is 602/225-5295. CITE: (W-115 SN447963)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: Y--Construction of Structures and Facilities OFFADD: USDA Forest Service, Procurement Office, 1700 Bypass Road, Winchester, Kentucky 40391 SUBJECT: Y--U-28 DAM ACCESS ROAD CONSTRUCTION SOL RFQ R9-12-00-27 DUE 060900 POC Steven E. Mumford (606)745-3127; Russ Christensen (812)547-7051 DESC: The Contractor shall provide all labor, supervision, equipment, materials and incidental supplies necessary to construct an access road to the U-38 Dam located on the Tell City Ranger District of the Hoosier National Forest in Crawford County, Indiana. This project is located approximately 1.5 miles east of Indiana Route 145; 5 miles southeast of Birdseye, Indiana. Take Dubois County Route 12 east off SR 145 approximately 1 mile, and turn left (north) on the next road to the left. The project starts at the Forest Service property line. A pre-quote meeting/site visit will be held on or around May 18 or 25, 2000, depending upon the issue date of the solicitation being on or around May 9, 2000. This project will consist of construction of approximately 0.98 mile of single-lane, aggregate surfaced road, with turnouts, to accesss the U-38 dam. The new road construction will include clearing, grubbing, preparation of roadbed and drainage structures; installation of approximately 11 culverts, and surfacing with 4 inches of No. 53 aggregate. The project will also include the obliteration of approximately 400 feet of existing roadway. The price range for this project is between $25,000 and $100,000. The project will be solicited using Request for Quotation procedures on an unrestricted basis. Requests for solicitation packages may be faxed to: USDA-Forest Service, Daniel Boone National Forest, Attn: Steven E. Mumford at Fax Number (606)745-4710. CITE: (W-115 SN447972)
[Commerce Business Daily: Posted in CBDNet on April 24, 2000] [Printed Issue Date: April 26, 2000]

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: Y--Construction of Structures and Facilities OFFADD: U. S. Army Engineer District, Savannah, P.O. Box 889, Savannah, Georgia 31402-0889 SUBJECT: Y--DESIGN/BUILD COMBAT AVIATION BRIGADE BARRACKS COMPLEX SOL DACA21-00-R-0026 DUE 060800 POC Technical POC, Beth Shields (912)652-5664, Contracting POC, John Moore (912)652-5291 DESC: The project consists of the design and construction of multiple facilities on a site of approximately 55 acres bounded by wetland. Facilities will include barracks building for 512 soldiers, company operations facilities, battalion headquarters, brigade headquarters, and aero-medical facility. Supporting facilities will include parking, concrete pavement, sidewalks, water, sewer, electrical service, fire alarm systems, storm drainage, erosion control measures, information systems, and landscaping. Geotechnical investigation and topographic survey of the construction site have been completed and will be provided at Phase Two. Requirements will be provided in narrative format and bubble diagrams. Army Standard Designs may be used but will not be required. The complex shall be designed and built by registered architects and engineers employed by or subcontracted by their organization. This project will be procured using the Two-Phase Design-Build Selection Procedures at FAR 36.3. In Phase One, offerors will receive a Request for Proposal letter including the project description and submittal requirements, and evaluation factors for both phases. The evaluation factors for Phase One will be Past Performance, Technical Approach/Narrative and Specialized Experience. No more than five offerors will be invited to participate in Phase Two. The Government anticipates that the Phase Two RFP documents will be issued on or about 10 August 2000. The SIC code for this project is 1542. The estimated value of the project is between $50 million and $80 million. This solicitation is issued on an UNRESTRICTED BASIS pursuant to the "Business Opportunity Development Reform Act of 1988" (Public Law 100-656). All responsible sources are invited to participate in Phase One and will be considered. PHASE ONE OF THE SOLICITATION WILL BE ISSUED ON PAPER COPIES ONLY. PHASE TWO OF THE SOLICITATION WILL BE ISSUED IN ELECTRONIC FORMAT ONLY. In order to register to receive copies of Phase One of the Request for Proposals, contractors must submit a written request citing the RFP number and title. Requests must reach this office no later than 15 days from the date of this announcement. Submit requests by facsimile or mail to: FAX (912)652-5828, or U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Savannah District, P.O. Box 889, 100 West Oglethorpe Avenue, ATTN: CESAS-CT-C, Elaine Radcliffe, Savannah, GA 31402-0889 ON THE INTERNET AT: http://www.sas.usace.army.mil/ebs/. Amendments to this solicitation will be posted on the internet at the above adress unless the total amended compressed files are greater than 5 MBYTES, in which case a new CD-ROM disk will be issued. For amendments that are only posted on the internet, an SF 30 (Amendment of Solicitation/Modificaiton of Contract) and a list of revised specificiations and drawings will be mailed to each bidder. Request for proposal documents may be faxed. LINKURL: http://www.sas.usace.army.mil/ct/index.html LINKDESC: EMAILADD: louis.j.moore@sas02.usace.army.mil EMAILDESC: CITE: (W-115 SN448007)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: Z--Maintenance, Repair or Alteration of Real Property OFFADD: Department of Transportation, St. Lawrence Seaway Development Corporation (SLSDC), SLSDC Headquarters, P.O. Box 520, 180 Andrews Street, Massena, NY, 13662 SUBJECT: Z--ASBESTOS ABATEMENT PROJECT AT EISENHOWER AND SNELL LOCKS SOL DTSL55-00-R-C0549 DUE 061400 POC Linda Harding, Contracting Officer, Phone (315) 764-3244, Fax (315) 764-3235, Email lmh@sls.dot.gov - Patricia White, Contract Specialist, Phone (315) 764-3236, Fax (315) 764-3235, Email plw@sls.dot.gov DESC: The St. Lawrence Seaway Development Corporation (Corporation) plans to issue a Request for Proposal (RFP) for an asbestos abatement project in the galleries at both Eisenhower and Snell Locks in Massena, New York. This project will include sampling and testing dusts/residues for asbestos, cleanup and /or encapsulation of asbestos-containing dusts/residues, and possible removal and disposal of up to 1,500 feet of asbestos-containing pipe insulation. The dust/residue sampling will be required for approximately 2,800 feet of galleries. The magnitude of the cleanup and removal and disposal efforts will be determined by the test results. The RFP will be released approximately May 12, 2000 and the deadline for receipt of proposals shall be approximately June 14, 2000. The estimated cost range for this project is between $25,000 and $100,000. There will be a $30.00 US Funds non-refundable fee for the drawings. Requests for the RFP package along with the $30.00 fee must be received no later than 15 days after Commerce Business Daily publication. This will be a Firm-Fixed Price contract. In accordance with the Small Business Competitiveness Demonstration Program, this procurement is open to both large and small businesses. All responsible sources may submit a proposal, which will be considered by the St. Lawrence Seaway Development Corporation. The standard industrial classification code is 1799. THIS NOTICE IS FOR INFORMATIONAL PURPOSES FOR MINORITY, WOMEN-OWNED AND DISADVANTAGED BUSINESS ENTERPRISES: The Department of Transportation (DOT) Office of Small and Disadvantaged Business Utilization (OSDBU), has programs to assist minority, women-owned and disadvantaged business enterprises to acquire short-term working capital and bonding assistance for transportation-related contracts. This is applicable to any eligible prime or subcontract at any tier. Loans are also available under the DOT Short-Term Lending Program (STLP) at prime interest rates to provide accounts receivable financing. The maximum line of credit is $500,000.00. The Bonding Assistance Program enables firms to apply for bid, performance and payment bonds up to $500,000. DOT provides an 80% guaranty on the bond amount to a surety against losses. For further information regarding the bonding and lending programs, please call the DOT Office of Small and Disadvantaged Business Utilization at (800) 532-1169. LINKURL: http://www.eps.gov/cgi-bin/WebObjects/EPS?ACode=P&ProjID=DTSL55-00-R-C0549&LocID=2602 LINKDESC: notice EMAILADD: lmh@sls.dot.gov EMAILDESC: CITE: (D-112 SN447692)

Box 4970, Jacksonville, Florida 32232-0019 SUBJECT: Z--MAINTENANCE DREDGING, 12-FOOT PROJECT, BARGE CANAL, CANAVERAL HARBOR, FLORIDA SOL DACW17-00-B-0028 DUE 061500 POC Contract Specialist, Barbara Byam, (904) 232-1120 DESC: Project work includes the removal of approximately 207,000 cubic yards of shoal material from the Canaveral Harbor Barge Canal to a required depth of 12-feet plus 1-foot allowable over-depth. Work also includes cleaning of an existing disposal area adjacent to the large canal, incineration of debris, and turbidity monitoring. Contractor will be required to obtain a State of Florida Gopher Tortoise Take Permit. Equipment needed would include, but not be limited to, the following: Dredge and all support equipment, bulldozer, and marine equipment for transporting bulldozers and other equipment used for clearing and incineration. Construction time is 114 calendar days. Magnitude of construction is between $1,000,000 and $5,000,000. Solicitation will be issued on or about 01 May 2000 and open on or about 15 June 2000. Solicitation will be issued in electronic format only. Bidders will be provided a CD-ROM at no cost. Interested offerors must register electronically. The registration form is located at http://www.saj.usace.army.mil/. (Select Business Opportunities.) THIS PROCUREMENT IS 100% SET-ASIDE FOR SMALL BUSINESS CONCERNS. All small business concerns are encouraged to submit a bid. You must be registered in the Central Contractor Registration in order to be eligible to receive an award from this solicitation. Call 1-888-227-2423 for more information. SIC Code 1629, size standard $13.5 million. S. Fish and Wildlife Service invites bids on a solicitation for Entrance Road Rehabilitation at the Great Swamp National Wildlife Refuge, Basking Ridge (Morris County), New Jersey. The work shall include all plant, labor, materials, and equipment necessary for the preparation, repair, and placing an 8 inch thick layer of select fill and placement of base course and surface coarse payment on entrance roadway surfaces. Work also will include replacing and providing new culverts and transitions. Culvert replacement and transitions will involve exposing, excavating, and disposal of some small amounts of asbestos contaminated soils. Estimated magnitude of this project is between $100,000.00 and $250,000.00. The SIC code for this acquisition is 1611; size standard is $17 million. This is an unrestricted procurement in accordance with Public Law 100-656 and is open to any size business. All responsible sources may submit a bid which shall be considered. Issue date will be o/a May 12, 2000. All requests must be submitted in writing to the address above. TELEPHONIC REQUESTS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED. FAX Requests will be accepted at (413) 253-8450)or email at address indicated below. Any request for a solicitation package shall include the company name, address, telephone number, name of company point of contact, and should be identified by the solicitation number and the title shown above. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: Z--Maintenance, Repair or Alteration of Real Property OFFADD: Facilities Service Offcice, 4000 DeKalb Technology Pkwy., Ste. 300, Atlanta, GA 30340-2799 SUBJECT: Z--INDEFINITE QUANTITY ROOFING CONTRACT FOR SOUTH GEORGIA&11 SOUTH CAROLINA COUNTIES SOL 123125-00-A-0048 DUE 060100 POC Leslie L. Martin (770) 454-0660 DESC: This solicitation invites proposals for an Indefinite Quantity Roofing Contract for the South Georgia&11 South Carolina area. Proposal amount will be in the form of a two digit single multiplier to be applied against a unit price schedule for future work orders which include, but are not limited to, work that may be involved within the scope which includes minor alterations, repairs, and replacements for roof work in post offices and postal facilities. Asbestos work related to roof repairs and/or replacement may be required under this contract. The contract essentially is a unit price standard type arrangement for either a two year initial contract period with three one-year renewal options for a maximum contract value of $9,500,000. Performance and payment bonds will be required from the successful offeror. The contract may be extended by increments of $250,000 up to $9,500,000 by change order and appropriate increase in bond amounts. The MINIMUM contract value is $10,000. Proposal amount will be in the form of a two digit single multiplier to be applied against a unit price schedule for future work orders. Multiplier awards may be made if it is considered to be in the best interests of the Postal Service. Complete solicitation packages may be obtained directly from LDI Printing by calling (770) 939-5277. All charges for solicitation packages are nonrefundable. Credit cards are the preferred method of payment. Only offers returned via personal hand delivery and/or US Postal Service (First Class Mail, Express Mail and Priority Mail) will be considered in compliance with this solicitation. Any other carriers will be rejected. EMAILADD: lmartin7@email.usps.gov EMAILDESC: CITE: (W-115 SN447816)

SOL DTCG83-00-B-3WF233 POC Audrey Overholt, Contract Specialist, Phone 216-902-6217, Fax 216-902-6277/78, Email aoverholt@ceucleveland.uscg.mil DESC: Provide all labor, materials, equipment, supervision and transportation required for dredging approximately 20,000 cubic yards of dredge material from Fishing Creek Channel; from the Coast Guard Station to Day Marker #2. Provide a dredge depth of _10_ below MLW and a width of 40_. Provide an itemized cost for mobilization of barge dredge, cranes, and miscellaneous required heavy equipment. Additional item is to provide price for additional dredging. The period of performance is 90 days after Notice to Proceed. This procurement is estimated between $250,000.00 and $500,000.00 and is open to both small and large businesses in accordance with the Small Business Competitiveness Demonstration Program. The SIC code for this procurement is 1629 (dredging). Due dates for bids will be not less than 30 days after bid issuance. NO TELEPHONE REQUESTS WILL BE ACCEPTED_DO NOT CALL TO INQUIRE WHEN THE PLANS AND SPECS WILL BE AVAILABLE. You must register for them via the following websites. A Pre-Bid walk-thru is scheduled for May 23, 2000, at 10:00 p.m. local time. The Bid Opening Date is June 13, 2000, at 2:00 p.m. local time. This is a 100% Small Business Set-Aside Acquisition. Box 17300, 819 Taylor Street, Attn: CESWF-CT, Fort Worth, TX 76102-0300 SUBJECT: Z--MAINTENANCE PAINTING OF DRAFT TUBE GATES AND OTHER STRUCTURES, SAM RAYBURN DAM AND RESERVOIR, ANGELINE RIVER, TEXAS SOL DACW63-00-B-0023 DUE 061300 POC Beverly Johnson, 817-978-3576 DESC: Firm-Fixed Price contract. Work is for maintenance painting of draft tube gates and other structures, Sam Rayburn Dam and Reservoir, Angelina River, Texas. The base bid will be for the painting of one draft tube gate with an option for painting of an additional draft tube gate and an option for painting of dogging devices, guide rails and embedded steel in draft tube gate slots. The Government intends to issue this solicitation and all amendments through the use of the Internet. No additional media (CD ROMS, Floppy Disks, Faxes, or paper) will be provided unless the Government determines that it is necessary. Contractors may view/download this solicitation and all amendments from the Internet after solicitation issuance at the following Internet address: "http://ebs.swf.usace.army.mil". All bidders are required to check the Fort Worth District Contracting Division website daily to be notified of any changes to this solicitation. Estimated Cost Range: $100,000.00 to $250,000.00. Solicitation to be issued on or about 11 May 2000 with bid opening on 13 June 2000. Bids from all qualified business concerns are solicited. Duration of the contract is 135 days for the base and both options. Standard Industrial Classified (SIC) code for this project is 1799 and the size standard is $7 million per year.

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: Z--Maintenance, Repair or Alteration of Real Property OFFADD: Contracting Officer, ROICC Annapolis, 181 Wainwright Road, U.S. Naval Academy, Annapolis, MD 21402-5013 SUBJECT: Z--INDEFINITE DELIVERY/INDEFINITE QUANTITY MULTIPLE AWARD CONTRACT FOR MINOR CONSTRUCTION PROJECTS AT THE UNITED STATES NAVAL ACADEMY, ANNAPOLIS, MD SOL N62477-00-R-0609 POC Barbara J. Palmer (410) 293-3188 DESC: INDEFINITE DELIVERY/INDEFINITE QUANTITY MULTIPLE AWARD CONTRACT FOR MINOR CONSTRUCTION PROJECTS AT THE UNITED STATES NAVAL ACADEMY COMPLEX, ANNAPOLIS, MARYLAND SOLICITATION N62477-00-R-0609. The Resident Officer in Charge of Contracts is soliciting proposals for multiple award contracts to accomplish minor construction projects at the Naval Academy Complex. Projects may include new construction, routine renovation and repair of facilities including administrative office spaces, family housing units, warehouses, laboratories, classrooms and industrial facilities. Projects may also include requirements for asbestos removal, design/build, equipment installation and repair or replacement of mechanical and electrical systems. This procurement will result in the award of multiple Indefinite Delivery/Indefinite Quantity contracts with a performance period of one base year and four option periods not to exceed a total duration of five years. At the Government's option, throughout the term of this contract, Task Orders will be issued on a competitive or sole source basis to the awardees. Task order minimum and maximum limits are $2,000.00 and $250,000.00 respectively. The maximum contract value, encompassing all contracts awarded shall not exceed $1,000,000.00 for each contract period. Contracts will be awarded using competitive negotiation procedures requiring the submission of technical proposals. Award(s) will be made considering such evaluation criteria as cost/price, past performance and the following technical/management factors; relevant experience, design/build experience and capabilities, management plan (on/off site), subcontractor management capabilities and financial capacity. The solicitation will be issued on or about 09 May 2000. The tentative date scheduled for receipt of proposals is 15 June 2000. A site visit and pre-proposal conference will be held on 16 May 2000 at 0900. The solicitation will contain specific details regarding the site visit. The SIC code for this solicitation is 1542 and the Small Business Size Standard is $17,000,000.00. THIS PROCUREMENT IS UNRESTRICTED. The solicitation will be available at http://esoladmin.navfac.navy.mil. Inquiries regarding this procurement must be submitted to Barbara Palmer via e-mail at the following address: palmerbj nadn.navy.mil.

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: Z--Maintenance, Repair or Alteration of Real Property OFFADD: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, 600 M.L. King, Jr. Pl., Rm 821, Louisville, KY 40202-2230 SUBJECT: Z--BOILER CONVERSION, DEFENSE SUPPLY CENTER, COLUMBUS, OHIO SOL DACA27-00-B-0007 DUE 060800 POC Technical point of contact, Lynn Raque (502)582-5990, Contracting point of contact, Elaine McKim (502)582-6295 DESC: DSCC currently has a Central Plant and distribution system to various buildings that is comprised of two 70 MMbtu/hr. Riley Stoker coal fired high temperature hot water generators and one 40 MMbtu/hr. natural gas fired unit. This project converts one of the 70 MMbtu generators to a gas fired unit. This new unit will become the primary generator for the central plant. The work includes removal and demolition of selected components of the boiler and associated equipment as well as installation of new equipment and repair of some existing equipment, including new dampers and expansion joints, modifications to breaching, refractory, fan drive, and controls. DSCC has been and continues to convert buildings on the installation to individual building systems and the central plant will be phased out in the future, but elimination of the coal fired equipment as the primary generator is preferred now. The new gas fired burner is rated below the existing burner due to the decreased demand. Estimated cost is $500,000 - $1,000,000. SIC code for this project is 1711. THIS IS NOT A SMALL BUSINESS SET-ASIDE. Solicitation will be issued o/a May 9, 2000, and the last day for receipt of bids will be approximately June 8, 2000 at 2:00 p.m. (local time). There will be no charge for this solicitation package and each request will be limited to one package only. This project is available on CD ROM and the Internet. Project files are portable document format (PDF) files and can be viewed, navigated, or printed using adobe acrobat reader (available on CD). System requirements are: 386- or 486-based personal computer (486 recommended), Microsoft Windows 3.1 or greater, 4 MB application RAM, 4 MB hard disk space, and compact disk drive. Interested offerors MUST register through the Louisville District homepage at http://www.lrl.usace.army.mil/ebs in order to receive the CD. Any subsequent amendments to this particular solicitation may be downloadable from this same site. Once you have accessed the web site select the referenced solicitation number. Telephone requests/faxes WILL NOT be honored. Any Technical questions may be directed to Mr. Lynn Raque at: (502)582-5990.
LINKURL: http://www.lrl.usace.army.mil/ebs LINKDESC: Solicitation page CITE: (W-115 SN448059)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: Z--Maintenance, Repair or Alteration of Real Property OFFADD: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Contracting and General Services, 300 Westgate Center Drive, Hadley, MA 01035-9589 SUBJECT: Z--HISTORIC REPAIR AND RENOVATION PROJECT AT JOHN HAY NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE SOL 501810B012 DUE 070600 POC Dale Aubin, 413-253-8230, Marsha Browning, 413-253-8236 DESC: The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS) is planning to undertake necessary repairs to the historic John Hay Estate located at the John Hay National Wildlife Refuge in Newbury (Lake Sunapee), NH. This project will include repairs to the Main House(1891-1930's), Barn(1890's), Gate House (1931), landscape features, and unpaved roadways. It is the intent of the USFWS to contract with a general contractor experienced in the renovation of historic structures. This entity may be supported by specialized trades, if not available in house for the following areas: Historic roof repairs; rough and finish carpentry; mechanical, electrical and plumbing work, plaster repairs, and painting. This will be a two-step sealed bidding process. Interested firms shall submit, in writing, their qualifications based on listed requirements below and those determined qualified will be asked to submit a sealed bid in accordance with FAR 14.5. Interested firms shall present a minimum of five historic building renovation projects undertaken within the last eight years. The following information shall be provided for each of these projects: 1) Project name, 2) Original budget, 3) Change orders, 4) Summary of work, 5) Date of completion, 6) Client name, address and phone number, and 7) Design professional's name, address and phone number. In addition, firms shall present evidence of his/her ability to work within a site that is open to the public and his/her ability to work within a tight schedule. The same information will be necessary for each of the specialized trades listed above. A mandatory attendance pre-bid meeting with the pre-qualified firms will be scheduled for the week of June 19 at the site. Qualification factors used for the evaluation of firms shall be; 1) Past experience in historic building renovation projects (30%); 2) Multi-disciplined experience including historic roof repairs, rough and finish carpentry, mechanical, electrical and plumbing work, plaster repairs and painting in historic buildings (25%); 3) Ability to provide product on time and within budget (20%); 4) Ability to work within a site that is open to the public (15%); and 5) Ability to work within a tight time schedule (10%). Firms desiring consideration should submit two copies of their resume (qualifications) and all other appropriate information as described above to: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, 300 Westgate Center Drive, Hadley, MA 01035-9589, ATTN: Dale E. Aubin, Contracting Officer, not later than close of business May 15, 2000. CITE: (W-115 SN448066)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SERVICES CLASSCOD: Z--Maintenance, Repair or Alteration of Real Property OFFADD: General Services Administration, Public Buildings Service (PBS), Western Area (7PW), 819 Taylor Street, Rm 12A15, Fort Worth, TX, 76102 SUBJECT: Z--RENOVATE FIRST FLOOR RESTROOMS AT 525 GRIFFIN ST. DALLAS, TX SOL GS-07P-00-UAM-5023 POC Vicki Woodard, Contracting Officer, Phone (817) 978-3722, Email vicki.woodard@gsa.gov - Vicki Woodard, Contracting Officer, Phone (817) 978-3722, Email vicki.woodard@gsa.gov DESC: SIC Code1542 -Proposals are limited to firms with active offices within the State of Texas. Provide all labor and materials for the renovation of the first floor restrooms at 525 Griffin Street, Dallas, TX. Work includes but not limited to demolition of existing architectural, mechanical and electrical items on the first floor restrooms. Remodel with new floor and wall tile, vinyl wallcovering, acoustical panel ceilings, countertop lavatories, toilet partitions and toilet accessories with mechanical and electrical items to provide completed facilities. To meet ADA requirements, demolition of existing architectural, mechanical, and electrical items on the first floor utility/mop closet to be converted to unisex restrooms. Construction of a new unisex restroom with new interior gypsum walls, new floor and wall tile, vinyl wallcovering, acoustical panel ceiling, lavatories and toilet accessories with mechanical and electrical items to provide a completed facility. The time of construction is 60 days. The solicitation will be issued on or about 5/12/00 with proposals being due on or about 5/30/00. The estimated cost of the project is between $25,000 to $100,000. Project No. ITX96002, Solicitation No. GS-07P-00-UAM-5023. This project is being issued using negotiated procedures which will result in a firm fixed price award to the Offeror who provides the "best value" to the Government. This full and open procurement is made under the Small Business Competitive Demonstration Program and all responsible firms are invited to submit a proposal. This solicitation will be available by contacting Vicki Woodard, Contracting Officer at (817) 978-3722 , fax (817) 978-7017, or email: vicki.woodard@gsa.gov. PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 12--Fire Control Equipment OFFADD: US Army ARDEC, AMSTA-AR-PC, Picatinny Arsenal, New Jersey 07806-5000 SUBJECT: 12--COMMON REMOTELY OPERATED WEAPON STATION (CROWS) SOL DAAE30-00-R-0407 DUE 073100 POC JANICE FINKELSTEIN, CONTRACT SPECIALIST, (973)724-7510 DESC: The U.S. Army TACOM-ARDEC Product Manager for Small Arms, located at Picatinny Arsenal, NJ has a requirement for a mature Common Remotely Operated Weapon Station (CROWS). The CROWS is a light-weight, remote weaon station capable of mounting the MK19 grenade machine gun (GMG), M2 HB machine gun (MG), M240B machine gun(MG) or M249 squad automatic weapon (SAW). The system is mounted on the host vehicle with the target acquisition and engagement control capability inside the vehicle. The CROWS will include: the weapon mount, an electronics support unit, a remote control unit, fire control processor, sensors, and associated hardware. The CROWS will be integrated into various turreted/non-turreted and ring-mount equipped vehicles and will provide a modern automated weapon system that enhances system lethality, increases battle space awareness, and provides digital integration opportunities. The CROWS will provide protection for the gunner and enhanced target acquisition, identification, and engagement capabilities to non-turreted light armored vehicles which currently place the unprotected gunner at high risk from enemy direct and indirect fire weapon systems. The acquisition will be divided into three distinct efforts which shall be referred to as Task I, II, and III. Task I will be a six month effort and will result in the delivery of two prototype CROWS systems meeting the technical requirements described under this task. Task II will be an 18 month development effort, performed concurrent with Task I and will result in the delivery of six complete CROWS systems meeting specific technical requirements. Task III will be a three month effort, concurrent with Task II, to develop and deliver integration kits for two vehicles, which will be used to conduct Development and Operational Tests culminating in Type Classification. There will also be a production option for up to an additional fifteen (15) CROWS units. This procurement requires access to classified material controlled under the American, British, Canadian and Australian (ABCA) Armies' Standardization Program. Only industry from ABCA countries have been determined to be eligible to participate at this time. Bidders must possess a SECRET facility security clearance, subject to verification. The present schedule projects release of a competitive Request for Proposal (RFP)approximately in June 2000. Proposals shall be required within forty-five (45)days after release of the RFP. All responses to this notice shall be done so in writing in the English laguage. See numbered Note 26. Springer, Contract Specialist, AMSAM-AC-TM-C, 256-876-0845 or Colleen Rodriguez, Contracting Officer, AMSAM-AC-TM-C, 256-876-8840 DESC: The U.S. Army Aviation and Missile Command (AMCOM), Multiple Launch Rocket System (MLRS) currently has a requirement for the redesign, testing, and qualification of an existing fire control panel design (Bradley Tactical Processing Unit) to meet the requirements of the M270A1 launcher at a reduced lifecycle cost. It will require final design and qualification efforts to include qualifying panels, upgrade of test launchers, development of new test console, rehost of software, update of logistics products, and system level testing. This requirement is sole source to Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control, Dallas, Texas. EMAILADD: springerea@redstone.army.mil EMAILDESC: CITE: (W-115 SN448068)

PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS (MODIFICATION) SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 15--Aircraft and Airframe Structural Components OFFADD: ASC/YFKA, Building 50, 2130 Fifth Street Wright-Patterson AFB, OH, 45433-7003 SUBJECT: 15--F-22 LOW RATE INITIAL PRODUCTION LOT 2 SOL F33657-00-R-0020 DUE 050900 POC Lt Rebecca Bridgewater, Negotiator or Ms. Patricia Blakely, PCO,Lt Bridgewater 937-255-1695 x2246 or Ms. Blakely, PCO at x2243 DESC: "Potential Sources Sought. This is not an RFP. Potential sources sought: ASC/YFK is conducting a market survey for F-22 Low Rate Initial Production (LRIP) aircraft and associated equipment and program support for Lot 2, and field support capability. The anticipated sixteen (16) aircraft are part of the LRIP phase of F-22 development with delivery dates beginning in November 2003 and continuing through September 2004. The F-22 aircraft blends low observability with advanced avionics, a highly maneuverable lightweight airframe, and the ability to supercruise. The F-22 is designed to detect, engage, and destroy an opposing force before detection. Further, the F-22 possesses air-to-air as well as air-to-ground capability. Lockheed Martin Aeronautical Systems (LMAS), Marietta, GA, is currently the prime contractor for the engineering and manufacturing development of the F-22 aircraft as well as the production of the Production Representative Test Vehicles (PRTV), PRTV II, and LRIP Lot 1. Responsible sources are sought for Lot 2. Offerors must provide written notice to the contracting officer of their interest and capability to satisfy the government requirement no later than 17 Feb 00. The offeror must: (1) possess program management, fabrication/assembly, and quality assurance personnel; (2) possess the material, engineering, factory and flight test equipment and physical facilities;(3) be a responsible contractor with demonstrated recent total aircraft system and field support responsibility; (4) be capable of delivering qualified aircraft in accordance with the above schedule; and (5) include in their response to this notice evidence of these capabilities. The offeror shall also indicate their size status in relation to SIC code 3721. Reprocurement data is not available. Note that the production of the supplies listed requires a substantial initial investment or an extended period of preparation for manufacture and field support. Also, it is impractical to distribute the applicable specifications with this market survey. These contract documents may be examined or obtained from ASC/YF, Builing 50, 2130 Fifth Street, Wright-Patterson AFB, OH 45433-7003. An Ombudsman has been appointed to address concerns from offerors or potential offerors during the proposal development phase of this acquisition. The Ombudsman does not diminish the authority of the program director or contracting officer, but communicates contractor concerns, issues, disagreements, and recommendations to the appropriate Government personnel. When requested, the Ombudsman shall maintain strict confidentiality as to the source of the concern. The Ombudsman does not participate in the evaluation of proposals or in the source selection process. Interested parties are invited to call ASC's Ombudsman, Stephen J. Plaisted, at (937)255-5535 or (937)255-9095 or e-mail stephen.plaisted@wpafb.af.mil. This synopsis is not to be construed as a commitment on the part of the Government to award a contract nor does the government intend to directly pay for any information or responses submitted as the result of this solicitation. " LINKURL: http://www.pixs.wpafb.af.mil/pixslibr/00R0020/00R0020.asp LINKDESC: EMAILADD: Rebecca.Bridgewater@asc-yf.wpafb.af.mil EMAILDESC: CITE: (D-115 SN447888)

The offeror must: (1) possess program management, fabrication/assembly, and quality assurance personnel; (2) possess the material, engineering, factory and flight test equipment and physical facilities; (3) be a responsible contractor with demonstrated recent total aircraft system and field support responsibility; (4) be capable of delivering qualified aircraft in accordance with the above schedule; and (5) include in their response to this notice evidence of these capabilities. Note that the production of the supplies listed requires a substantial initial investment or an extended period of preparation for manufacture and field support. Also, it is impracticable to distribute the applicable specifications with this market survey. The Ombudsman does not participate in the evaluation of proposals or in the source selection process. Interested parties are invited to call ASC's Ombudsman, Stephen J. Plaisted, at (937) 255-5535 or (937) 255-9095 or e-mail stephen.plaisted@wpafb.af.mil. This synopsis is not to be construed as a commitment on the part of the Government to award a contract nor does the government intend to directly pay for any information or responses submitted as the result of this solicitation." PART: U.S. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENTS SUBPART: SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL CLASSCOD: 15--Aircraft and Airframe Structural Components OFFADD: USPFO for California, Contracting Office, PO Box 8104, San Luis Obispo, CA 93403-8104 SUBJECT: 15--DETAILS MINIMUM SOFTWARE REQUIRMENTS FOR TESTING&TROUBLESHOOTING THE STABILATOR AMPLIER SOL DAHA04-00-R0003 DUE 050800 POC Debra E. Fugate , 805-594-6295 DESC: This specification details minimum software requirements for testing and troubleshooting the Stabilator Amplifier P/N 70902-02001-048 to return to RFI condition. Test software shall consist of the following: run on the ESATS P/N SAC-512, perform operational, chassis (including flex cable and related circuity) and board diagnostics test. Utilize the Fluke 99 Scopemeter for waveform time domain, AC voltge (etc.) measurements. Include pitch rate gyro testing using Ideal Aerosmith rate table Model 1270VS. Contain all necessary interface cables between the ESATS and the stabilator amplifier. Be commercial off-the-shelf. Functionally test the 70902-02001-048 Stabilator Amplifier and its SRU'S at a minimum as detailed in DMWR 11-6615-306 dated 31 Oct. 1996 using the ESATS P/N SAC -512. Provide hookup instructions (both text and pictorial). Specify ambiguity groups of no greater than 10 with an active component ambiguity level of 2. An active component consists of at least two or more P-N junctions. Operate using Windows95 operating system on an IBM compatible GFE PC meeting the following minimum requirements: 133 MHz Pentium processor, 32 MB Ram, 8 x or greater CD Rom, two (2) serial com ports (3 if using serial mouse), 2 GB minimum hard drive, color monitor with 600 x 800 minimum resolution, 56.6K or greater modem. Provide proper alignment procedure for lateral accelerometer, Bias adjustment. Provide test print outs consisting of all test result (both pass and fail). Printout shall be capable of being saved to disk. Provide real time, on screen test results for each test, including actual and expected output. Test execution history and all results shall remain accessible during and at conclusion of the test. Compare and display, through software, the accepted measurements and waveforms as defined by the DMWR versus the actual acquired values. Allow independent operational, diagnostic or gyro testing. Upon detection of a failure, stop the test, display the failure, maintain the test configuration (energized/de-energized), display corrective actions and allow probing of the circuit using the Fluke Scopemeter if desired by the operator. Allow the operator to: abort the test, abort the initiate diagnostic tests, continue the test. Display complete CAD drawn schematics of the failed circuit. Provide 100% software control of the Scopemeter. Operator shall only be required to connect the Scopemeter as outlined in the hookup instructions resident in the software and turn it on. Test the gyro while installed in the Stabilator Amplifier on the rate table. Rate table shall be software controlled. Automatically compensate for input voltage amplitude deviations for rate gyro tests. Delivery shall be 30 days ARO. EMAILADD: debbie.fugate@ca-arng.ngb.army.mil EMAILDESC: CITE: (W-115 SN448056)
